description: To get slow-cooked flavours without the wait, try this recipe that uses Woolworths slow-cooked roast beef and transforms it into a rich beef bourguignon.
keywords: Dinner,High fibre,High protein,Seafood free,Tree nut free,Low sugar,Sesame free,Beef,Mushroom,Peanut free,Jul 2021
name: Cheat's slow-cooked beef bourguignon Recipe | Woolworths
recipeIngredient: 500g Woolworths COOK roast beef with onion & garlic gravy
1 large brown onion, cut into thin wedges
100g middle bacon rashers, fat trimmed, roughly chopped
600g washed red potatoes, peeled, chopped into 2cm pieces

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat oven to 210°C/190°C fan-forced. Line a baking tray with baking paper.
Cook beef according to packet instructions. Place mushrooms, onion and bacon on tray. Drizzle with oil, then bake for 25 minutes or until vegetables are tender.
Meanwhile, cook potato in boiling water for 15 minutes or until tender. Drain. Return to pan. Add spread and milk, then mash potato until smooth. Season.
Add mushroom mixture, including cooking juices, to beef mixture, then stir to combine.
Cook peas in a saucepan of boiling water for 1 minute or until just tender. Drain. Divide mash, beef mixture and peas among plates. Serve topped with parsley.
